description: race (“having a characteristic taste (of wines, fruits, etc.)”) +‎ -y.

examples: She wore a racy dress that was just barely appropriate for the occasion.

entries.meaning: Having a strong flavor indicating origin; of distinct characteristic taste; tasting of the soil.
(figurative, by extension) Exciting to the mind by a strong or distinctive character of thought or language; peculiar and piquant; fresh and lively.
(programming) Involving a data race or a race condition.
examples: We evaluate the automatic fence insertion procedure by running our tool on a number of different benchmarks containing racy code.
